intro: Boechera retrofracta, commonly known as the rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Boechera retrofracta has small, white or pale yellow flowers and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, sometimes lobed shape.
